column4: Hi i am trying to login to a website but i cant it says i must have the latest version of firefox
latest update
http://pastebin.com/m5cec3
can i tell admin to change because it is my daughers fotboll club website and they dont have a big It department
what needs to be changed?
sorry
http://pastebin.com/m5cec3fcc
http://www.kallhallsff.se/
or higher
it might be checking the version string incorrectly
which version of firefox are you using?
what's the version shown in help > about mozilla firefox?
that pastebin entry is empty
apparently it is looking for firefox 2.0
I was just able to access that site using 3.0.8
does that only happen with a correct username and password?
which version of firefox do you have on windows?
I'm not sure if removing the version checks would be a good idea
it depends on how the site is set up
firefox doesn't use activex so the site itself likely doesn't use it.  If it does, then it would only be used for IE
it depends on the way the site is set up
usually, yes
